unnormalised: In a stunning upset at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai, India lost to Australia by 79 runs in the final T20 match. The Indian team, chasing a target of 210, were all out for 131 in 18.3 overs. The top scorer for India was Virat Kohli with 35 runs.
normalised: In a stunning upset at the Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai, India lost to Australia by seventy nine runs in the final T-twenty match. The Indian team, chasing a target of two hundred and ten, were all out for one hundred and thirty one in eighteen point three overs. The top scorer for India was Virat Kohli with thirty five runs.

unnormalised: Australia's David Warner was declared Man of the Match for his explosive innings of 85 runs off 52 balls, including 7 fours and 4 sixes. The Australian bowling attack was spearheaded by Pat Cummins, who took 4 wickets for just 28 runs. The match attendance was reported to be approximately 45,000.
normalised: Australia's David Warner was declared Man of the Match for his explosive innings of eighty five runs off fifty two balls, including seven fours and four sixes. The Australian bowling attack was spearheaded by Pat Cummins, who took four wickets for just twenty eight runs. The match attendance was reported to be approximately forty five thousand.

unnormalised: The series, however, was won by India 2-1, thanks to their earlier victories in the first two matches. This marks India's 5th consecutive T20 series win on home soil. The next international cricket match scheduled in India is on 12/11/2024.
normalised: The series, however, was won by India two to one, thanks to their earlier victories in the first two matches. This marks India's fifth consecutive T-twenty series win on home soil. The next international cricket match scheduled in India is on twelfth November two thousand and twenty four.

Sports analysts are already predicting the team's chances in the upcoming I-C-C World Cup, with odds at three divided by one.
